author: Amy Stevenson
title: Christie Hayes mocks Amber Sherlock on jacketgate: Can I get a blazer please? Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7
text:
Share Christie Hayes mocks Amber Sherlock on jacketgate: Can I get a blazer please? Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7 
First it was Amber Sherlock and Julie Snook's fiery clash over a white shirt, and now Christie Hayes and Sarah Cumming have had their own wardrobe malfunction! VIDEO Christie Hayes mocks Jacketgate. Source: Channel Seven Christie Hayes mocks Jacketgate 
Appearing on The Daily Edition , Christie joined the panel to talk about her new role on Wollongong’s i98FM breakfast show wearing an off-the-shoulder pink dress, while co-host Sarah was also sporting a dress in the same shade! Christie wore pink on The Daily Edition. Source: Channel 7 But so did host Sarah Cummings! Awkward! Source: Channel 7 
"Sorry about the colour. I should have gotten a blazer," Christie said, referring to the moment Channel Nine's Amber insisted Julie put on a jacket when she turned up also wearing white for a live TV segment. 
The 30-year-old former Home and Away star then jokingly called out to producers: "Can I get a blazer please? We're both wearing pink." 
Of course, it's hard to forget Julie and Amber's catfight that went viral last month after the outburst, which took place just before they went to air, was caught on camera and leaked by an unknown source. 
"I need Julie to put a jacket on, because we're all in white," Amber says at the start of the footage, which shows the two women in different studios. Fellow commentator psychologist Sandy Rae laughs, presumably thinking Amber must be joking. Three women in white in the viral video. Source: Nine Julie ended up putting on a jacket at Amber's request. Source: Nine 
Sandy, in a third studio, then offers to try and find a jacket for herself as she, too, is wearing white but Amber only has eyes for Julie's outfit. 
"You're [al]right," she tells Sandy. "It's fine, Sandy – but there can't be three of us." Christie scored a new job on Wollongong’s i98FM breakfast show. Source: Supplied The busy mum-of-two has gone back to work! Source: Supplied 
Meanwhile Christie also opened up to the Channel Seven program about her new role on radio after returning to work following the birth of her sons. 
"It is great, I don't know how I got this job because I've never done radio before, but it is so much fun," she told Sarah and co-host Tom Williams. 
"I have a great team, we have so much enthusiasm." 
Christie previously spoke to Be after her first breakfast show, saying while it was hard to leave her two sons, Hendrix, two and year-old Harley, she was up for the challenge of being a working mother. 
RELATED: Former 'Home and Away' star Christie Hayes says parents should take kids travelling 
"It's like 'what were you thinking?!', obviously I have a really supportive husband and that makes such a difference," she said, praising husband Daniel White. 
"I'm up at 4am now and not at the house when my babies wake up so that's difficult because I'm obviously missing out on that but one of has to work, it's a busy world and I love what I do and I've missed working as well. 
"So I get up at 4am yes, but there's a lot more hours in the day now and my husband has the boys and he's now working from home.... I'm a big believer that the universe doesn't give you what you can't handle so when this came up I thought there was no way I could say no." Christie and husband Daniel on their special day last year. Source: Supplied Christie started her new job last month. Source: Instagram She has spoken about juggling motherhood with working. Source: Instagram Christie Hayes as Kirsty Sutherland, with Tammin Sursock and Bec Hewitt on 'Home and Away' UP NEXT
